alert.note: Alert for McIntosh (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 15 at 11:47PM CDT until April 16 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MCINTOSH AND SOUTHEASTERN MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 1147 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southeast of Rentiesville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Warner... Porum... Webbers Falls... Rentiesville... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 267 and 287. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
